Posts.EditableText:
Still in much disagreement (since I posted definition); although, it's hard to provide correct grammar to a phrasal form that's incorrect to begin with...

Everybody else and (I or me) is much clearer as "us" or "we."  "Else" excludes the "other party," so why would you include "yourself."  But if the speaker is trying to exclude a single person or group, which the speaker and everyone else is not a part of, then "Everyone besides (him, her, them)" is much more agreeable.
